result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathon David Wierstad was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED***
Per Judge Eric J. Lundell January 27, 2017 - amend Victim name in the No Contact.

Defendant to report to Probation today January 20, 2017.
Bond continues until Defendant reports to Probation.
Probation may be transferred to Minnesota.
Defendant is eligible for expungement upon successful completion of Probation.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

DNA surcharge.
Subpoena fees.

-Follow rules and regulations of Agent.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes, DF ATTY: John A. Kucinski, DF: Jonathon David Wierstad appeared.  Court called.  There is an agreement.  State files an Amended Information with the Court.  DA Nieskes recites the agreement.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads the charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads No Contest to the amended Ct 1.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and the finds DE adjudicated guilty of the amended Ct 1.  Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

Amended Ct. 1
S/W 1 year probation with conditions
- DE's probation may be transferred to Minnesota 
- DE sentenced to 6 days in the St. Croix County Jail with credit for 6 days served
- DE is ordered that he have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, C.T.M..  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  
- Restitution to be determined within 30 days of this hearing
- Court costs of $268.00 and $250.00 for the DNA Surcharge apply money on file and refund the remaining balance to the payor
- DE to provide the St. Croix County Sheriff's Department with a DNA sample
- DE can apply for expungement after successfully completing probation
- DE to report to probation today 01/20/2017
- DE's bail bond is to remain in effect until the DE has signed up for probation and then it is vacated 
- 20 days to appeal
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 20, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes, DF ATTY: John A. Kucinski, DF: Jonathon David Wierstad appeared.  Court called at 9:51 p.m.  Set for STC.  ADA Nieskes advises Attorney Kucinski has filed multiple motions.  State makes argument regarding the DE's expert witness.  ADA Nieskes argues the fact the expert witness should provide a written report to the State to help minimize the time needed for the Daubert Hearing.  Attorney Kucinski is requesting the State pay for his expert witness to attend the Daubert Hearing.  State argues the expert witness needs to be found qualified through a Daubert Hearing.  State argues this burden is on the DE since it is his expert witness.  Attorneys make arguments.  Court will issue a written decision.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned at 10:11 a.m. lw

Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress Statements and Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress Evidence. Filed by Atty Kucinksi. km

*AMENDED* 
*It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Stacie N.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  

*No contact with Stacie N on premises of where CTM is.

*It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, CTM - DOB 2/23/2011 or premises where CTM is; Cedric M.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  C.M.T. 1/23/2011, Stacy N. or Cedric M.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
